column1: When the Old Woman reached her cabin she sat down by the door and wailed
column2: for she knew that she had no means of defending herself against the Boar. While she sat crying a vender of needles came along and asked her what was the matter. She told him
column3: but all that he could do for her was to give her a box of needles. The Old Woman stuck the needles thickly over the lower half of the door
column5: and then went on crying.Just then a Man came along with a basket of crabs
column7: and stopped to inquire what was the matter. She told him
column8: but he said he knew no help for her
column9: but he would do the best he could for her by giving her half his crabs. The woman put the crabs in her water jar
column11: and again sat down and cried.
